questions.question: Which transformation changes the size of an object but keeps its shape?
A shear transformation will:
options: a. Tilt an object while keeping one side fixed
b. Flip the shape over an axis
d. Rotate the shape about the origin
questions.correctAnswer: a. Tilt an object while keeping one side fixed

questions.question: If a transformation preserves the shape and size of an object, it is:
Which transformation moves a point $(x,y)$ to $(-x,y)$?
options: d. Scaling by -1 in the y-direction

questions.question: Scaling is defined by which two parameters?
options: a. Angle and axis of rotation

questions.question: Which transformation has no fixed points except when the distance moved is zero?
A triangle is rotated 180° about the origin. What is the image of the point $(3,-2)$?
A figure is enlarged by a scale factor of 3 with respect to the origin. The point $(4,-1)$ maps to:
Which sequence of transformations could map a flag at $(2,3)$ to $(-2,-3)$?
options: a. Reflection across the y-axis, then reflection across the x-axis
c. Scaling by factor 2, then reflection across y-axis
questions.correctAnswer: a. Reflection across the y-axis, then reflection across the x-axis

questions.question: If a transformation preserves angles but changes lengths, it is:
Which of the following best describes tessellation?
options: a. The art of folding paper into shapes
b. A pattern that covers a surface without gaps or overlaps
c. A pattern that repeats in three dimensions only
d. The study of plant growth patterns
questions.correctAnswer: b. A pattern that covers a surface without gaps or overlaps

questions.question: Which of the following shapes can form a regular tessellation?
Which of the following is not a regular polygon that can tessellate by itself?
Which type of symmetry is common in tessellations?
Which real-life example is an irregular tessellation?
options: b. M. C. Escher's artwork of interlocking birds and fish
d. Tiled bathroom floor made of identical hexagons
questions.correctAnswer: b. M. C. Escher's artwork of interlocking birds and fish

questions.question: Which tessellation type is formed by repeating a square in a grid pattern?
A tiling pattern uses two regular polygons: squares and equilateral triangles. What type of tessellation is it?
Which property ensures that a shape can tessellate the plane?
options: a. Its interior angles divide evenly into 180°
b. Its interior angles sum to 180°
c. Its interior angles divide evenly into 360°
d. It has more than 4 sides
questions.correctAnswer: c. Its interior angles divide evenly into 360°

questions.question: A brick wall pattern uses rectangles in rows, with each row offset from the previous one. This is an example of:
What is a frieze pattern?
options: a. A pattern that covers a whole plane without gaps
b. A repeating pattern that extends infinitely in one direction
c. A design made with circles
questions.correctAnswer: b. A repeating pattern that extends infinitely in one direction

questions.question: How many types of frieze patterns are there according to symmetry classification?
Which symmetry is always present in a frieze pattern?
If a frieze pattern has both translation and 180° rotation, which type of symmetry does it have?
What is the approximate value of the Golden Ratio ($ϕ$)?
The Golden Ratio is most commonly represented by which Greek letter?
Which of the following best defines the Golden Ratio?
options: a. The sum of two numbers divided by the larger is equal to the larger divided by the smaller
b. The product of two numbers equals their sum
c. The sum of two numbers equals the square of the larger number
d. The difference between two numbers equals the smaller number
questions.correctAnswer: a. The sum of two numbers divided by the larger is equal to the larger divided by the smaller

questions.question: Which is the main difference between a fractal and a regular polygon?
options: b. Fractals show infinite detail at different scales, polygons do not
c. Polygons are irregular, fractals are always regular
questions.correctAnswer: b. Fractals show infinite detail at different scales, polygons do not

questions.question: A rectangle has a width of 8 cm. If it is in the Golden Ratio, what is its approximate length?
A sunflower has 34 spirals in one direction and 55 in the opposite direction. Which mathematical concept does this illustrate?
Two rectangles have the same width. Rectangle A has a length that follows the Golden Ratio, and Rectangle B has a length 1.5 times its width. Which is closer to $ϕ$?
A rectangle is constructed with side lengths in the Golden Ratio, $ϕ$. If the shorter side is 5 cm, what is the length of the longer side, to the nearest hundredth of a centimeter?
Which of the following is a key characteristic of fractal geometry?
options: a. It is made of straight lines only
b. It repeats smaller versions of its shape along its structure
d. It is a one-dimensional curve
questions.correctAnswer: b. It repeats smaller versions of its shape along its structure

questions.question: Which mathematical concept helps in creating tessellations in digital art and animation?
In a tiled mosaic, a floral motif is repeated across the floor in evenly spaced rows and columns. Which symmetry transformation is primarily used?
If you cut a snowflake pattern along one of its lines of symmetry, what would you observe about the two halves?
options: a. They are identical mirror images
c. They are scaled versions of each other
d. They have different shapes but equal areas
questions.correctAnswer: a. They are identical mirror images

questions.question: Which linear transformation moves every point of a shape by the same distance in the same direction?
A pentagon is reflected over the y-axis and then translated 4 units up. What is the image of $(-5,2)$?
A rectangle is first scaled by a factor of 0.5 in both directions, then rotated 90° counterclockwise. Which property is preserved?
A pattern is created by repeatedly reflecting a triangle across different lines to fill the plane. This process is most related to:
Which transformation flips a figure over a line, producing a mirror image?
If you apply a shear transformation in the x-direction with a shear factor of 2 to point $(1,3)$, what are the new coordinates?
A square is reflected over the line $y=-x$. The point $(2,5)$ becomes:
A butterfly's wings are an example of which type of symmetry?
Which of the following is a real-life example of a frieze pattern?
Which famous artist is known for creating complex tessellations with interlocking animals and people?
Which natural pattern is an example of a tessellation?
options: a. The veins of a leaf
b. The cells in a honeycomb
c. The branches of a tree
d. The spiral of a seashell
questions.correctAnswer: b. The cells in a honeycomb

questions.question: Why can't a regular pentagon tessellate a plane?
options: a. It is not a polygon
b. Its interior angles do not divide evenly into 360°
questions.correctAnswer: b. Its interior angles do not divide evenly into 360°

questions.question: In a tessellation, what happens if the shapes leave gaps?
options: a. It is still considered a tessellation
b. It is no longer considered a tessellation
d. It becomes a semi-regular tessellation
questions.correctAnswer: b. It is no longer considered a tessellation

questions.question: Which transformation is a combination of a reflection and a translation?
In analyzing the Mandelbrot set, which feature indicates fractal behavior?
options: a. A single repeating shape only once
b. Infinite zoom revealing similar patterns
questions.correctAnswer: b. Infinite zoom revealing similar patterns

questions.question: Which of the following is a key characteristic of the Fibonacci sequence?
options: a. Each number is double the previous number
b. Each number is the sum of the two preceding numbers
c. Each number is a prime number
d. Each number is the product of the two preceding numbers
questions.correctAnswer: b. Each number is the sum of the two preceding numbers

questions.question: The ratio of consecutive terms in the Fibonacci sequence approaches which number?
What is the 9th number in the Fibonacci sequence (starting with 0, 1, ...)?
A rectangle with side lengths 13 and 8 is an approximation of which geometric concept?
Which is an example of the Golden Ratio found in nature?
options: a. The perfect symmetry of a square
b. The spiral of a nautilus shell
c. The circular shape of a raindrop
d. The linear growth of a bamboo stalk
questions.correctAnswer: b. The spiral of a nautilus shell

questions.question: What is the interior angle of a regular octagon?
A spiral of a snail's shell is an example of which type of symmetry?
A point $(x,y)$ is moved to $(x+a, y+b)$. What kind of transformation is this?
What is the mathematical term for a pattern that can cover a plane without any gaps or overlaps?
The golden ratio is the limit of the ratio of which mathematical sequence?
What is the image of a point $(2,-5)$ after a reflection across the x-axis?
How many degrees does a star with 5 points need to be rotated to be symmetric?
A pattern has reflection symmetry across the y-axis. The point $(3,4)$ is transformed to:
Which of the following is an example of a fractal in nature?
Which type of symmetry is a combination of a translation and a reflection?
A point $(x,y)$ is rotated 90° counterclockwise about the origin. The image is:
A rectangle with side lengths $1$ and $ϕ$ is called:
What is the next number in the Fibonacci sequence: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...?
Which type of transformation is also known as a slide?
